answers.answer: I am not sure if the high sugar levels can affect fertility. I know with PCOS the reason you get cysts on the ovaries is because of high blood sugar which is from something called insulin resistence which can present a lot like diabeties. I am not sure if actual diabeties can affect you in the same way. Any doctor will tell you that 2 months is not a long time to be trying and depending on your age you should wait 6 to 12 months before seeing a fertility doctor. I don't think the reasons for you c section would cause you problems but I do know if there is too much scar tissue that can cause problems with the egg implanting. Give it a few more months and see what happen. Good luck

Please don't worry too much that you haven't conceived yet in just 2 months.  I know it's frustrating when you're trying to conceive but 2 months is a very short space of time.  Your c-section should not effect your chances of conceiving at all.  I am not familiar with the ins and outs of medication for diabetes so I can't respond on that score.Try and relax and make sure you are having intercourse at the right time in your cycle, eat healthily etc etc  GOOD LUCK!

question: hi i am having difficulty in concieving after my csection done before 8 months due to placental abruption of my twin children.  now for the past 2 months i m trying to get pregnant again but not concieving. wat would be the problem? i am under insulin novomix 30 flexpen morning 14units and 10 units during night due to diabetes. if anybody answer me i feel better and appreciate ur help
title: difficulty in concieving after my csection
